pageContext.claim: “We want to solve this immigration problem, which is going on for 40 years, more. It's been going on forever. ”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, families are being separated because of a "zero tolerance" policy from the Trump administration dating to April 2018. No law, whether passed by Democrats or otherwise, requires these separations. Essentially, Trump's executive order just retracted his own policy, which he could have reversed without an order. Migration over the U.S. - Mexico border increased dramatically in the early 2000s.
